qas.question: Who assists the Superintendent of Police?

answers.text: the officers of the Himachal Police Service and other Himachal Police officials.

qas.question: Who is in charge of the Indian Administrative Service?
Who maintains town municipalities of the district?
What is the Indian Administrative Service comprised of?
What group does a panchayat officer belong to?
What is each geographical unit divided into and governed by a district?

context: A district of Himachal Pradesh is <b5_0>an administrative geographical unit<b5_0/>, headed by a <a0_0><b3_0>Deputy Commissioner or District Magistrate<b3_0/><a0_0/>, an officer belonging to <b6_0>the Indian Administrative Service<b6_0/>. The district magistrate or the deputy commissioner is assisted by a number of officers belonging to Himachal Administrative Service and other Himachal state services. Each district is subdivided into <b7_0>Sub-Divisions<b7_0/>, governed by a sub-divisional magistrate, and again into Blocks. Blocks consists of panchayats (village councils) and town municipalities. <b4_0>A <a1_0>Superintendent of Police<b4_0/><a1_0/>, an officer belonging to the Indian Police Service is entrusted with the responsibility of maintaining law and order and related issues of the district. He is assisted by <a2_0>the officers of the Himachal Police Service and other Himachal Police officials.
